definition: luxuriant/buxom/variant of 豐|丰[feng1]/variant of 風|风[feng1]/appearance/charm
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: The growers are busy day and night, with harvest smile on his face.
sentences.chinese: 果农们日夜忙碌，脸上带着丰收的微笑。

sentences.english: Indications point toward a bumper crop.
sentences.chinese: 各种迹象表明丰收在望。

sentences.english: Drooping ears of rice promise another good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 沉甸甸的稻穗预示着又一次丰收。

sentences.english: The thankful Pilgrims included the Indians in their harvest celebration.
sentences.chinese: 心存感激的新移民在庆丰收时也邀请了印第安人参加。

sentences.english: With a bumper harvest in sight, joy reigned over us.
sentences.chinese: 丰收在望，我们满怀喜悦。

sentences.english: Villagers are gathering at the entrance of the village to celebrate this year's grain harvest.
sentences.chinese: 村民们在村头集会，庆贺今年的粮食丰收。

sentences.english: Dropping ears of rice promise another good harvest .
sentences.chinese: 沉甸甸的稻穗预示着又一次丰收。

sentences.english: The "First Thanksgiving" in 1621 was actually a harvest festival.
sentences.chinese: 第一次感恩节发生在1621年，为了庆祝农业丰收。

sentences.english: A rich harvest in a hungry land is impressive.
sentences.chinese: 缺粮地区的一场丰收是了不起的。

sentences.english: After a rainy winter , a plentiful summer.
sentences.chinese: 多雨的冬日，就有丰收的夏日。

sentences.english: Summer slowly faded, and Grandpa died before it was time to bring in the harvest.
sentences.chinese: 夏曰逐步磨灭，爷爷在丰收前就弃世了。

sentences.english: The peach word of the farm is big to get this year abundant, this ream we are very satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 今年农场的桃字大获丰收，这令我们非常满意。

sentences.english: This was his last harvest. (Photo and caption by Gemma Collier)
sentences.chinese: 这是爷爷经历的最后一次丰收。

sentences.english: The harvest season for early rice is about to come.
sentences.chinese: 早稻的丰收季节即将到来。

sentences.english: Dropping ears of rice promise another good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 沉甸甸的稻穗预示着又一个丰收。

definition: abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
favorable weather (idiom); good weather for crops
heavily laden with fruit/fertile (of trees)/many noteworthy achievements
lit. prodigious abundance of fruit (idiom)/fruit hangs heavy on the bough/fig. countless accomplishments/one great result after another
ear of grain/gerbe (used on coats of arms)
